result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Venus Mildred Marquez-Melendez

records.addlTxt:
Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
(this is corrected date - mailed out 10/19/22)

3:19 PM Venus Mildred Marquez-Melendez appears in Court, Atty Alex Stormont appears by phone, DA Halle E. Hatch for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions non-appearance, she was running late. Court will QUASH the WARRANT and reinstate the bond. DA Hatch states if DE shows up late she will be remanded into custody and a cash bond will be requested. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:24 pm.
Status conference scheduled for November 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on November 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:24 AM  Venus Mildred Marquez-Melendez does not appear in Court,  Atty Alex Stormont, Atty Kaley Walker for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Walker is requesting a warrant adj. States. Atty Stormont states he did have contact with her this weekend. Court will authorize the warrant.
Status conference on October 18, 2022 at 11:15 am.
filed by ADA Kaley Walker. eif
Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. Def pleas NG. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:44 pm.

2:35 AM Defendant Venus Mildre Marquez Melendez appeared in Court,  Atty Alex Stormont, ADA Kaley Walker for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes this was set for a PH but DE was running late. Atty Stormont files a waiver of the PH. Court questions DE. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

ADA Walker is asking for a warrant but to stay until the PH date. DE now appears at 10:04 am. Contact with interpreter at 10:07 am. Interpreter Mariana Kralewski. S/T at 8:40 am. Court withdraws the stayed warrant. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 10:12 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant to maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Not to possess controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Def from PCJ

3:02 PM Defendant Venus Mildre Marquezmelendez appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Sally Nichols. Court swears in interpreter. Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Schieffer is requesting a $10,000.00 SIBS w/conditions AS & no controlled substances, no objection. Court so orders. The PD's Office will not be involved in the case. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:21 pm.
